data:
T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T4 subcategories: T4a - extension to the chest wall; T4b - ulceration and/or edema of the skin of the breast; T4c - both T4a and T4b; T4d - inflammatory carcinoma.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T4 subcategories: T4a - extension to the chest wall; T4b - ulceration and/or edema of the skin of the breast; T4c - both T4a and T4b; T4d - inflammatory carcinoma.
The T stage does not consider the lymph node status, which is represented by the 'N' in the AJCC staging system.
The T stage does not involve the presence or absence of metastasis, represented by the 'M' in the AJCC staging system.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.
T4 subcategories: T4a - extension to the chest wall; T4b - ulceration and/or edema of the skin of the breast; T4c - both T4a and T4b; T4d - inflammatory carcinoma.
The T stage does not consider the lymph node status, which is represented by the 'N' in the AJCC staging system.
The T stage does not involve the presence or absence of metastasis, represented by the 'M' in the AJCC staging system.
Tumor grade does not affect the T stage, it is used for prognosis and treatment planning.
